Description: Large jar made of straw tempered Nile silt and many white inclusions. It has a flat base, walls expanding to moderate shoulder, and rolled rim. Surface is discoloured from poor firing conditions in kiln and shows several fire clouds.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911),p. 21; pl. xxxiv.80a. Pot is also shown in grave pl. ix.44 Like Rough ware R84a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric pottery. Marked H21 on side in faded ink.
